Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Okay let me try to tackle this problem step by step First I need to understand the users query thoroughly The task is to analyze three cases Case 1 2 3 based on given normative rules and desiderata Ill start by recalling the normative constraints and the desiderata to make sure I dont miss any points

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Starting with the normative process behavior The key points here are the strict sequence and ordering rules The sequence must be Application Received  Credit Check  Risk Assessment  Loan Decision  Inform Applicant  If Approved Finalize Documentation  Close Case Ordering rules are crucial here For example Credit Check before Risk Assessment Risk Assessment before Loan Decision Inform Applicant after Loan Decision Also if approved Finalize Documentation must happen before closing If rejected closing happens without finalizing docs

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Now looking at the event log table for each case Case 1 The steps are in order Application Credit Check Risk Assessment Loan Decision Approved Inform Finalize Docs Close That seems to follow all the normative rules The timestamps are sequential without any skips So no normative violations here

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Case 2 The first red flag is after Application Received the next activity is Risk Assessment at 0820 but the Credit Check was done later at 0900 That violates the normative rule that Credit Check must come before Risk Assessment So thats a violation Then after Loan Decision Rejected they did Finalize Documentation at 1000 before closing But since its a rejection Finalize Documentation shouldnt happen at all Thats another normative violation So Case 2 has two normative violations out of order Credit Check and Risk Assessment and Finalize Docs after a rejection

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Case 3 The Credit Check happened 2 days after Application from 1 12 to 1 14 which is more than 24 hours But since this is a desideratum recommended but not required thats not a normative violation However the normative sequence is followed here Next the Inform Applicant happened on 1 16 at 1500 which is two days after the Loan Decision 1 14 at 1200 The recommendation is within 48 hours but since its a desideratum thats a timing issue but not a normative violation Also theres no Follow up Call but thats also a desideratum Normatively the sequence seems correct here all steps in order So no normative violations here just desideratum issues

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Now moving to the desiderata part for each case Case 1 The Credit Check was done 30 minutes after the Application which is well within 24 hours Inform Applicant was done 2 hours after Loan Decision within 48 so they met the desiderata

Name: Backtracking - PE
Text: However theres no mention of a Follow up Call so thats a desideratum failure But the users example for Case 3 mentions no Follow up but in the table for Case 1 the log doesnt have one Wait looking back at the table in Case 1 the events listed end at Close Case The Follow up Call is part of the desiderata but optional So Case 1 didnt do the Follow up so thats a desideratum violation Wait the users example in the log for Case 3 mentions No Follow up Call but for Case 1s log the user didnt mention it so I should check the table The table for Case 1s row after Close Case doesnt have a follow up So actually all three cases might not have follow up calls unless explicitly stated Wait the log for Case 1 does not include a Follow up Call activity so thats a desideratum issue Wait but in the problems Part 2 the desiderata includes perform a Follow up Call sometime before closing So if the log doesnt have that activity its a desideratum violation So I need to check each cases log for Follow up Call

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Looking at the table Case 1s activities listed are up to Close Case no Follow up Call listed So thats a desideratum violation no follow up Similarly Case 2s log doesnt have it either Case 3 also does not have it So all three cases may have desideratum issues with the follow up Since the desiderata requires it sometime before closing the absence of that activity in any case would be a desideratum violation I should treat all cases that dont have the Follow up Call as missing it hence violating desiderata

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Moving on to the timing aspects Case 3 The Credit Check was on 1 14 which is two days after 1 12 so over 24 hours since 1 12 0900 to 1 14 1000 is two days later so thats a desideratum violation The Inform Applicant was 1 14 1200 to 1 16 1500 which is over 48 hours so another desideratum issue

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Now for Part 1 identifying normative violations Case 1 No violations All steps in order no skips and since it was approved Finalize Docs before Close is correct So compliant Case 2 Two violations First Risk Assessment before Credit Check order reversed Second Finalize Docs after Rejection which is forbidden Case 3 No normative violations The sequence is correct The Credit Check delay is a desideratum not a normative issue The timing for Inform Applicant is outside the 48 hour recommendation but thats a desideratum Finalize Docs after approval is done before closing so thats okay The rejection case isnt here So normative wise Case 3 is okay

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Now for part 2 desiderata violations For each case Case 1 The Credit Check was done 30 minutes after application within 24h  good Inform was 2 hours after decision within 48h  good But missing Follow up Call So the desiderata violations here are the missing Follow up Case 2 The Credit Check was done 40 minutes after application which is within 24 hours So no desideratum issue there For the Inform Applicant timing in Case 2 the Loan Decision was at 0930 and Inform was at 1000 which is within 48 hours just 30 minutes later So thats okay However the desiderata violations for Case 2 would be the lack of Follow up Call Case 3 Credit Check took more than 24 hours So thats a desideratum issue The Inform Applicant was over 48 hours So two desiderata issues here Credit Check timing and Inform timing plus missing Follow up All three cases have the Follow up Call missing

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Now for the third part suggest interpretations or justifications For example for Case2s normative issues maybe a staff error For the desiderata issues like delays maybe system overload or lack of resources or maybe the Follow up is optional and they skipped it due to workload
